titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Sam Antupit founded The Cycling Frog Press in 1960 in his basement in Pound Ridge, New York. He regularly produced booklets, announcements and other small items for friends and family. In 1994 he received an NEA grant that allowed him to travel the country recording various Native American storytellers then printing their tales in limited editions through Cycling Frog Press. For more than 40 years, Sam was a member of the Westchester Chappel, contributing a page to the yearly letterpress calendar produced by this collective of hobbyist printers.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to the Cycling Frog Press founded by Sam Antupit. Materials in the collection include: proofs and samples of work; broadsides, books, and keepsakes from various private presses and chappels; type specimen booklets and sheets; materials related to Bob Jones and the Glad Hand Press, including a wood printing block cut by John DePol; and photographs. The collection also includes materials related to a book project on Native American tales which was funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
